p: The minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) and minimal bactericidal concentration (MBC) values were assayed by our previously published microplate dilution method [ 20]. Briefly, 100 μL of bacterial suspension and twofold serially diluted sample solution (100 μL) were added to each well at a final density of 10 5 CFU/mL and incubated at 37°C for 24 h. Subsequently, resazurin solutions (20 μL, 0.1 mg/mL) were added to each well. After 2 h incubation at 37°C in the dark, the MIC values were determined as the minimum sample concentration without color change. For the determination of the MBC values, 10 μL of samples from the wells without color change was subcultured on Mueller-Hinton agar medium. After 24 h incubation at 37°C, the MBC values were determined as the minimum sample concentration without bacterial growth.
